definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: He wants to study Classical Tibetan English and Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 他还想学习古藏文，英语以及汐班牙语。

sentences.english: Primary school pupils of Nyingchi Prefecture practicing Tibetan calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 林芝地区小学生在练习藏文书法。

sentences.english: We shall start with the Tibetan version of the parable of the concealed elixir-producing tree.
sentences.chinese: 我们要以藏文版的隐蔽的妙药树的寓言故事开始。

sentences.english: Just because someone can understand Tibetan, doesn't mean that they can write well in their own language.
sentences.chinese: 一个人懂藏文，并不意味着他的母语写作就很好。

sentences.english: Tibetan language documents had recorded this word more than a thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 一千多年以前的藏文书籍中就记载了这个词汇。

sentences.english: Tibetan ancient books are an important component part of Tibetan documents.
sentences.chinese: 藏文古籍文献是藏学文献的一个重要组成部分。

sentences.english: This paper puts foward a new system for translation of mathematical symbol and formula into Tibetan.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了一个数学符号和式子藏文读法的翻译方案。

sentences.english: It contained, she was personally involved in the Chinese language Buddhist scriptures translated into Tibetan.
sentences.chinese: 据载，她还亲自参与将汉文佛经译为藏文。

sentences.english: It can't get you a job, not even as a school teacher.
sentences.chinese: 藏文不能帮你找工作，当个学校老师都办不到。

sentences.english: They were mainly taught English and Tibetan.
sentences.chinese: 他们主要学习英文和藏文。

sentences.english: The words on Dao seem to be Tibetan letter and Devanagari .
sentences.chinese: 刀上的文字似乎是藏文和梵文很象的。

definition: Chinese written language/Chinese literature esp. as taught abroad
Pali, language of Theravad Pali canon
Tripitaka Koreana, Buddhist scriptures carved on 81,340 wooden tablets and housed in Haeinsa 海印寺[Hai3 yin4 si4] in South Gyeongsang province of South Korea
sutra written on leaves of pattra palm tree
Syriac language (from c. 2nd century BC)/the Syriac script
volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
